title: Watering Tips
tips: Water most indoor plants when the top 1–2 inches of soil feel dry.
Avoid overwatering — it is the most common reason plants die.
Use room-temperature water to avoid shocking roots.
Ensure pots have drainage holes to prevent root rot.

title: Sunlight Tips
tips: Most indoor plants thrive in bright, indirect sunlight.
Rotate plants weekly so all sides receive light equally.
Avoid harsh afternoon sunlight, which can burn leaves.
Low-light plants can survive in shaded corners, but growth may slow.

title: Fertilizing Tips
tips: Fertilize only during the growing season (spring & summer).
Use a balanced liquid fertilizer every 4–6 weeks.
Avoid fertilizing stressed or newly-repotted plants.
Dilute fertilizer to half strength for sensitive plants.
